chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey L. Hopmann was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jeffrey L. Hopmann was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Mr. Hopmann to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years. This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being. This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, after one year of incarcertion 
 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

6/28/16: Court orders "Forthwith" shall be removed from JOC as sentence was ordered to run sonsecutive

--no operation of any motor vehicle

--maintain absolute sobriety

--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Case called at 4:17pm [mo]
Defendant Jeffrey L. Hopmann in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " NO CONTEST  " entered on Counts #1 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Hopmann   guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: all remaining counts 

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Hopmann

On Count #1: 
The Court sentences Mr. Hopmann   to  6  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years. This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being. This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program., after one year of incarcertion 
 

The Court gives   0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--no operation of any motor vehicle
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay fine in the amount of $3500 plus costs

The Court orders
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--36 month revocation of driving privileges
--36 month IID requirement
--attendance at Victim Impact Panel


On Count #3:
--to serve 9 months county jail, concurrent to the sentence in Count #1, to be served in prison
--to pay statutory costs; to be converted to civil judgment

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 4:37PM
State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications

Scheduled for FSSC:

Case called at 10:38am [mo]
Defendant Jeffrey L. Hopmann in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that resolution has not been met.
Atty. De La Rosa requests an adjournment
Atty. De La Rosa orally motions to withdraw as counsel; give basis.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Hopmann would like an opportunity to obtain private counsel. 

The Court inquires of Mr. Hopmann the desire to obtain new counsel

ADA Teuber conveys concern about delay of the case
ADA Teuber indicates that the State is prepared to proceed to trial next week.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that he is prepared to proceed to trial next week.

The Court denies the Defenses motion to substitute counsel; gives basis.

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that he prefers Tuesday for Trial date. 
The Court indicates that it will notify parties end of today/ tomorrow morning of day for Trial(Monday or Tuesday)

The Court and Counsel discuss procedural matters of Trial:
--No Miranda/Goodchild Issues
--Statements of Defendant will be admissable; limited to statements included in the Discovery
--one day trial
--5 strikes
--one alternate
--jurors can take notes and ask questions

The Court orders that the State file a Motion for Impeachment with Priors by end of day

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that is will notify the Court's JA whether a plea will be entered later today or proceed to jury trial
The Court conveys that today is the last day for Mr. Hopmann to enter a plea, if plan to enter plea will hold at 4:00pm

ADA Teuber conveys to the Court that the analyst is a #2 on Monday and #3 on Tuesday
recess: 10:55am

Scheduling Order
Jury trial on June 20 & 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

[MK] case called at 1:26pm. 
Defendant Jeffrey L. Hopmann appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Mr. Hopmann verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum and mandatory minimum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
-  No alcohol possession or consumption 
-  to take all medications only as prescribed
-  No possession of drug paraphernalia uinless prescribed
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Mr. Hopmann is to have the SCRAM bracelet installation before release from custody on this Bond.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
recess 1:34pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/28/15 at 9:20am   (2) Status Conference on 12/15/15 at 8:30am (JA- please note that case is at Prelim stage)
